I want to take a mini-diagnosis.title: Mini-diagnosis ğŸ”
I want to take a mini-diagnosis.text: Posture ğŸ§, breathing ğŸŒ¬ï¸, basic movements ğŸ¤¸ â€” then personalization ğŸ¯.

What is the nature of the pain?.Sharp: Sharp pain means the body needs rest ğŸ˜¥. Try to reduce the load and take care of yourself ğŸ¤².

What is the nature of the pain?.Dull: Dull pain often appears due to muscle overstrain ğŸ˜–. Light exercise and rest will help reduce it ğŸ§˜â€â™€ï¸.

What is the nature of the pain?.Pulling: Pulling pain may signal muscle imbalance ğŸ¯. Gentle stretching and strengthening exercises will be helpful ğŸ’ª.

What is the nature of the pain?.Burning: Burning pain is sometimes related to nerves ğŸ”¥. Move carefully and listen to your body ğŸ‘‚.

How long does the pain last?.Constant: Constant pain requires attention âš ï¸. Try to reduce load and consult a specialist if needed ğŸ©º.

How long does the pain last?.Periodic: Periodic pain is often related to load or stress ğŸ“Š. Watch the situations when it appears ğŸ”.

When did the pain appear?.For the first time: If the pain appeared for the first time, pay attention to the causes and avoid overloading the body ğŸ†•.

When did the pain appear?.A long time ago: Long-lasting pain requires a careful approach and gradual restoration of balance ğŸ“….

When did the pain appear?.Suddenly: Sudden pain may be related to a sharp movement or injury âš¡. Be careful ğŸš¨.

Were there injuries or surgeries?.Yes: Previous injuries and surgeries leave a mark on the body ğŸ©¹. Take this into account during loads âš–ï¸.

Were there injuries or surgeries?.No: There were no injuries or surgeries, so there are no special restrictions âœ….

Is there pain or radiation to another pa.Yes: Pain that radiates to other parts of the body may be related to nerves or muscles ğŸ”—. Move carefully ğŸ¢.

Is there pain or radiation to another pa.No: There is no radiating pain, you can safely continue usual movements ğŸ†—.

Does the pain increase with movement? If.Does not increase: Pain does not increase with movement, which is very good ğŸ‘.

Does the pain increase with movement? If.While walking: Pain while walking may indicate load on the feet, pelvis or lower back ğŸš¶â€â™‚ï¸. Move carefully and take breaks â¸ï¸.

Does the pain increase with movement? If.During bends/turns: Pain during bending is often associated with the lower back or thoracic region ğŸ”„. Strengthening exercises will help ğŸ’ª.

Does the pain increase with movement? If.With any activity: Pain increases with any activity, so it is worth reducing the load and listening to the body ğŸ”‡.

What provokes the pain?.Load: Pain from load indicates muscle weakness or overload ğŸ‹ï¸â€â™‚ï¸. Light recovery exercises will be useful ğŸ”„.

What provokes the pain?.Stress: Stress increases muscle tension ğŸ˜¤. Relaxing practices will help the body rest ğŸ§˜â€â™‚ï¸.

What provokes the pain?.Sleep: Pain after sleep may be related to posture or mattress ğŸ›Œ. Try changing position or a supportive pillow ğŸ›ï¸.

What provokes the pain?.Physical activity: Pain after activity indicates overstrain or poor technique âš™ï¸. Gentle warm-up and rest will help ğŸ§˜â€â™€ï¸.

Is there tension, numbness or tingling?.Yes: Tension, numbness or tingling may appear due to spasms or nerve compression ğŸ“. Gentle stretching and rest will help ğŸ§–â€â™€ï¸.

Is there tension, numbness or tingling?.No: No tension, numbness or tingling â€“ excellent! ğŸ‰

Is there tension, numbness or tingling?.Don't know: Watch sensations after load. If numbness or tingling appears, pay attention ğŸ‘€.

Is there swelling? When does it appear?.No swelling: No swelling, body is fine âœ….

Is there swelling? When does it appear?.In the morning: Morning swelling may be related to sleep or kidneys ğŸŒ…. Drink water during the day and limit salt in the evening ğŸš±.

Is there swelling? When does it appear?.In the evening: Evening swelling often appears due to leg load ğŸŒ†. Rest with elevated legs and light massage will help ğŸ›Œ.

Is there swelling? When does it appear?.During the day: Daytime swelling may be related to low mobility ğŸ™ï¸. Take breaks and stretch, watch water intake ğŸ’§.

Are there problems with breathing or che.Yes: If there are breathing difficulties, breathing exercises and chest relaxation will be useful ğŸ«.

Are there problems with breathing or che.No: There are no problems with breathing or chest, everything is good âœ….

Is the pain related to menstruation or c.Yes: Pain related to hormonal changes requires gentle load and attention to the pelvic area and lower back ğŸ©¸.

Is the pain related to menstruation or c.No: There is no connection of pain with menstruation or childbirth, you can move as usual ğŸ”„.

Is there a fever or general weakness?.Yes: If there is fever or weakness ğŸ¤’, it may be a systemic issue. Consult a doctor ğŸ©º.

Is there a fever or general weakness?.No: No fever or weakness â€” great âœ….

Have you noticed posture changes?.Yes: Posture changes ğŸ§ may affect the spine and muscles. Gentle corrective exercises will help ğŸ¤¸.

Have you noticed posture changes?.No: No posture changes detected, body balance is maintained âš–ï¸.

Do you want to add any additional inform.Yes: Additional information can help clarify the cause of pain ğŸ”.
